3.0.0-next.1574061351.638e36c0dc57eb870f.readme:
The Definitive List of Text Extensions


A package that contains an array of every single file extension there is for text files

Install

npm
  • Install: npm install --save textextensions
  • Require: require('textextensions')

jspm

 ``` html ```

Editions

This package is published with the following editions:

  • textextensions aliases textextensions/source/index.json
  • textextensions/source/index.json is JSON
## Usage ``` javascript console.log(require('textextensions')) ``` Missing an extension? [Send a pull request!](https://github.com/bevry/textextensions/edit/master/source/index.json) Want a definitive list of binary extensions? Check out [bevry/binaryextensions](https://github.com/bevry/binaryextensions) Want to detect if a file is text or binary? Check out [bevry/istextorbinary](https://github.com/bevry/istextorbinary)

History

Discover the release history by heading on over to the HISTORY.md file.

3.0.0-next.1574644318.af83983ef92c6aafb1.readme:
The Definitive List of Text Extensions


A package that contains an array of every single file extension there is for text files

Install

npm
  • Install: npm install --save textextensions
  • Require: require('textextensions')

jspm

 ``` html ```

Editions

This package is published with the following editions:

  • textextensions aliases textextensions/source/index.json
  • textextensions/source/index.json is JSON
## Usage ``` javascript console.log(require('textextensions')) ``` Missing an extension? [Send a pull request!](https://github.com/bevry/textextensions/edit/master/source/index.json) Want a definitive list of binary extensions? Check out [bevry/binaryextensions](https://github.com/bevry/binaryextensions) Want to detect if a file is text or binary? Check out [bevry/istextorbinary](https://github.com/bevry/istextorbinary)

History

3.3.0-next.1575921893.ac0ca1b246b0142cec.readme:
The Definitive List of Text Extensions


A package that contains an array of every single file extension there is for text files

Install

npm
  • Install: npm install --save textextensions
  • Require: require('textextensions')

jspm

 ``` html ```

Editions

This package is published with the following editions:

  • textextensions aliases textextensions/source/index.json
  • textextensions/source/index.json is JSON
## Usage ``` javascript console.log(require('textextensions')) ``` Missing an extension? [Send a pull request!](https://github.com/bevry/textextensions/edit/master/source/index.json) Want a definitive list of binary extensions? Check out [bevry/binaryextensions](https://github.com/bevry/binaryextensions) Want to detect if a file is text or binary? Check out [bevry/istextorbinary](https://github.com/bevry/istextorbinary)

History

4.0.0-next.1589196031.8d4fdf5691dc0f9317.readme:
The Definitive List of Text Extensions


A package that contains an array of every single file extension there is for text files ## Usage ``` javascript console.log(require('textextensions')) ``` Missing an extension? [Send a pull request!](https://github.com/bevry/textextensions/edit/master/source/index.json) Want a definitive list of binary extensions? Check out [bevry/binaryextensions](https://github.com/bevry/binaryextensions) Want to detect if a file is text or binary? Check out [bevry/istextorbinary](https://github.com/bevry/istextorbinary)

Install

npm
  • Install: npm install --save textextensions
  • Import: import * as pkg from ('textextensions')
  • Require: const pkg = require('textextensions')

jspm

 ``` html ```

Editions

This package is published with the following editions:

  • textextensions aliases textextensions/index.js which uses the Editions Autoloader to automatically select the correct edition for the consumer's environment
  • textextensions/source/index.json is JSON
  • textextensions/edition-node-14/index.js is json compiled for Node.js 14 with Require for modules
  • textextensions/edition-node-10/index.js is json compiled for Node.js 10 with Require for modules

4.1.0-next.1590010542.c2cdabad8a8764f758.title: The Definitive List of Text Extensions
4.1.0-next.1590010542.c2cdabad8a8764f758.name: textextensions
4.1.0-next.1590010542.c2cdabad8a8764f758.description: A package that contains an array of every single file extension there is for text files

editions.description: TypeScript source code with Import for modules
TypeScript compiled against ESNext for Node.js with Require for modules
TypeScript compiled against ES2019 for web browsers with Import for modules

scripts.our:compile: npm run our:compile:edition-browsers && npm run our:compile:edition-esnext && npm run our:compile:types
scripts.our:compile:edition-browsers: tsc --module ESNext --target ES2019 --outDir ./edition-browsers --project tsconfig.json && test -d edition-browsers/source && ( mv edition-browsers/source edition-temp && rm -Rf edition-browsers && mv edition-temp edition-browsers ) || true
scripts.our:compile:edition-esnext: tsc --module commonjs --target ESNext --outDir ./edition-esnext --project tsconfig.json && test -d edition-esnext/source && ( mv edition-esnext/source edition-temp && rm -Rf edition-esnext && mv edition-temp edition-esnext ) || true
scripts.our:compile:types: tsc --project tsconfig.json --emitDeclarationOnly --declaration --declarationDir ./compiled-types/ --declarationMap
scripts.our:deploy: echo no need for this project
scripts.our:meta: npm run our:meta:contributors && npm run our:meta:docs && npm run our:meta:projectz
scripts.our:release: npm run our:release:prepare && npm run our:release:check-changelog && npm run our:release:check-dirty && npm run our:release:tag && npm run our:release:push
scripts.our:release:check-changelog: cat ./HISTORY.md | grep v$npm_package_version || (echo add a changelog entry for v$npm_package_version && exit -1)
scripts.our:release:prepare: npm run our:clean && npm run our:compile && npm run our:test && npm run our:meta
scripts.our:release:push: git push origin master && git push origin --tags
scripts.our:release:tag: export MESSAGE=$(cat ./HISTORY.md | sed -n "/## v$npm_package_version/,/##/p" | sed 's/## //' | awk 'NR>1{print buf}{buf = $0}') && test "$MESSAGE" || (echo 'proper changelog entry not found' && exit -1) && git tag v$npm_package_version -am "$MESSAGE"
scripts.our:verify: npm run our:verify:directory && npm run our:verify:eslint && npm run our:verify:module && npm run our:verify:prettier

4.1.0-next.1590010542.c2cdabad8a8764f758.readme:
The Definitive List of Text Extensions


A package that contains an array of every single file extension there is for text files ## Usage [Complete API Documentation.](http://master.textextensions.bevry.surge.sh/docs/globals.html) ```javascript console.log(require('textextensions')) ``` Missing an extension? [Send a pull request!](https://github.com/bevry/textextensions/edit/master/source/index.json) Want a definitive list of binary extensions? Check out [bevry/binaryextensions](https://github.com/bevry/binaryextensions) Want to detect if a file is text or binary? Check out [bevry/istextorbinary](https://github.com/bevry/istextorbinary)

Install

npm
  • Install: npm install --save textextensions
  • Import: import pkg from ('textextensions')
  • Require: const pkg = require('textextensions').default

pika

 ``` html ```

unpkg

 ``` html ```

jspm

 ``` html ```

Editions

This package is published with the following editions:

  • textextensions/source/index.ts is TypeScript source code with Import for modules
  • textextensions aliases textextensions/edition-esnext/index.js
  • textextensions/edition-esnext/index.js is TypeScript compiled against ESNext for Node.js with Require for modules
  • textextensions/edition-browsers/index.js is TypeScript compiled against ES2019 for web browsers with Import for modules

4.2.0-next.1590049980.b51d172a8c66d68de3.readme:
The Definitive List of Text Extensions


A package that contains an array of every single file extension there is for text files ## Usage ``` javascript console.log(require('textextensions')) ``` Missing an extension? [Send a pull request!](https://github.com/bevry/textextensions/edit/master/source/index.json) Want a definitive list of binary extensions? Check out [bevry/binaryextensions](https://github.com/bevry/binaryextensions) Want to detect if a file is text or binary? Check out [bevry/istextorbinary](https://github.com/bevry/istextorbinary)

Install

npm
  • Install: npm install --save textextensions
  • Import: import * as pkg from ('textextensions')
  • Require: const pkg = require('textextensions')

jspm

 ``` html ```

Editions

This package is published with the following editions:

  • textextensions aliases textextensions/source/index.json
  • textextensions/source/index.json is JSON

TypeScript compiled against ES2019 for web browsers with Import for modules
TypeScript compiled against ES5 for Node.js with Require for modules

scripts.our:compile: npm run our:compile:edition-browsers && npm run our:compile:edition-es5 && npm run our:compile:types
scripts.our:compile:edition-browsers: tsc --module ESNext --target ES2019 --outDir ./edition-browsers --project tsconfig.json && ( test ! -d edition-browsers/source || ( mv edition-browsers/source edition-temp && rm -Rf edition-browsers && mv edition-temp edition-browsers ) )
scripts.our:compile:edition-es5: tsc --module commonjs --target ES5 --outDir ./edition-es5 --project tsconfig.json && ( test ! -d edition-es5/source || ( mv edition-es5/source edition-temp && rm -Rf edition-es5 && mv edition-temp edition-es5 ) )
scripts.our:compile:types: tsc --project tsconfig.json --emitDeclarationOnly --declaration --declarationMap --declarationDir ./compiled-types && ( test ! -d compiled-types/source || ( mv compiled-types/source edition-temp && rm -Rf compiled-types && mv edition-temp compiled-types ) )
scripts.our:deploy: echo no need for this project
scripts.our:meta: npm run our:meta:contributors && npm run our:meta:docs && npm run our:meta:projectz
scripts.our:release: npm run our:release:prepare && npm run our:release:check-changelog && npm run our:release:check-dirty && npm run our:release:tag && npm run our:release:push
scripts.our:release:check-changelog: cat ./HISTORY.md | grep v$npm_package_version || (echo add a changelog entry for v$npm_package_version && exit -1)
scripts.our:release:prepare: npm run our:clean && npm run our:compile && npm run our:test && npm run our:meta
scripts.our:release:push: git push origin master && git push origin --tags
scripts.our:release:tag: export MESSAGE=$(cat ./HISTORY.md | sed -n "/## v$npm_package_version/,/##/p" | sed 's/## //' | awk 'NR>1{print buf}{buf = $0}') && test "$MESSAGE" || (echo 'proper changelog entry not found' && exit -1) && git tag v$npm_package_version -am "$MESSAGE"
scripts.our:verify: npm run our:verify:directory && npm run our:verify:eslint && npm run our:verify:module && npm run our:verify:prettier

5.0.0-next.1590819186.b2b3bb02b9ca23983b.readme:
The Definitive List of Text Extensions


A package that contains an array of every single file extension there is for text files ## Usage [Complete API Documentation.](http://master.textextensions.bevry.surge.sh/docs/globals.html) ```typescript import list from 'textextensions' console.log(list) ``` ```javascript const list = require('textextensions').default console.log(list) ``` JSON also available via `textextensions/list.json` CDN access available via https://unpkg.com/textextensions/list.json Missing an extension? [Send a pull request!](https://github.com/bevry/textextensions/edit/master/source/index.ts) Want a definitive list of binary extensions? Check out [bevry/binaryextensions](https://github.com/bevry/binaryextensions) Want to detect if a file is text or binary? Check out [bevry/istextorbinary](https://github.com/bevry/istextorbinary)

Install

npm
  • Install: npm install --save textextensions
  • Import: import pkg from ('textextensions')
  • Require: const pkg = require('textextensions').default

pika

 ``` html ```

unpkg

 ``` html ```

jspm

 ``` html ```

Editions

This package is published with the following editions:

  • textextensions/source/index.ts is TypeScript source code with Import for modules
  • textextensions/edition-browsers/index.js is TypeScript compiled against ES2019 for web browsers with Import for modules
  • textextensions aliases textextensions/edition-es5/index.js
  • textextensions/edition-es5/index.js is TypeScript compiled against ES5 for Node.js with Require for modules

5.0.0-next.1590852381.47f14f0796fe2ac435.readme:
The Definitive List of Text Extensions


A package that contains an array of every single file extension there is for text files ## Usage [Complete API Documentation.](http://master.textextensions.bevry.surge.sh/docs/globals.html) ```typescript import list from 'textextensions' console.log(list) ``` ```javascript const list = require('textextensions').default console.log(list) ``` JSON also available via `textextensions/list.json` CDN access available via https://unpkg.com/textextensions/list.json Missing an extension? [Send a pull request!](https://github.com/bevry/textextensions/edit/master/source/index.ts) Want a definitive list of binary extensions? Check out [bevry/binaryextensions](https://github.com/bevry/binaryextensions) Want to detect if a file is text or binary? Check out [bevry/istextorbinary](https://github.com/bevry/istextorbinary)

Install

npm
  • Install: npm install --save textextensions
  • Import: import pkg from ('textextensions')
  • Require: const pkg = require('textextensions').default

pika

 ``` html ```

unpkg

 ``` html ```

jspm

 ``` html ```

Editions

This package is published with the following editions:

  • textextensions/source/index.ts is TypeScript source code with Import for modules
  • textextensions/edition-browsers/index.js is TypeScript compiled against ES2019 for web browsers with Import for modules
  • textextensions aliases textextensions/edition-es5/index.js
  • textextensions/edition-es5/index.js is TypeScript compiled against ES5 for Node.js with Require for modules

5.3.0-next.1591803008.3497fa76e34a2fb8df.readme:
The Definitive List of Text Extensions


A package that contains an array of every single file extension there is for text files ## Usage [Complete API Documentation.](http://master.textextensions.bevry.surge.sh/docs/globals.html) ```typescript import list from 'textextensions' console.log(list) ``` ```javascript const list = require('textextensions').default console.log(list) ``` JSON also available via `textextensions/list.json` CDN access available via https://unpkg.com/textextensions/list.json Missing an extension? [Send a pull request!](https://github.com/bevry/textextensions/edit/master/source/index.ts) Want a definitive list of binary extensions? Check out [bevry/binaryextensions](https://github.com/bevry/binaryextensions) Want to detect if a file is text or binary? Check out [bevry/istextorbinary](https://github.com/bevry/istextorbinary)

Install

npm
  • Install: npm install --save textextensions
  • Import: import pkg from ('textextensions')
  • Require: const pkg = require('textextensions').default

Deno

 ``` typescript import pkg from 'https://unpkg.com/textextensions@^5.3.0/edition-deno/index.ts' ```

pika

 ``` html ```

unpkg

 ``` html ```

jspm

 ``` html ```

Editions

This package is published with the following editions:

  • textextensions/source/index.ts is TypeScript source code with Import for modules
  • textextensions/edition-browsers/index.js is TypeScript compiled against ES2019 for web browsers with Import for modules
  • textextensions aliases textextensions/edition-es5/index.js
  • textextensions/edition-es5/index.js is TypeScript compiled against ES5 for Node.js with Require for modules
  • textextensions/edition-deno/index.ts is TypeScript source code made to be compatible with Deno

History

Discover the release history by heading on over to the HISTORY.md file.

5.5.0-next.1592729849.b6aec8361b3183c538.readme:
The Definitive List of Text Extensions


A package that contains an array of every single file extension there is for text files ## Usage [Complete API Documentation.](http://master.textextensions.bevry.surge.sh/docs/globals.html) ```typescript import list from 'textextensions' console.log(list) ``` ```javascript const list = require('textextensions').default console.log(list) ``` JSON also available via `textextensions/list.json` CDN access available via https://unpkg.com/textextensions/list.json Missing an extension? [Send a pull request!](https://github.com/bevry/textextensions/edit/master/source/index.ts) Want a definitive list of binary extensions? Check out [bevry/binaryextensions](https://github.com/bevry/binaryextensions) Want to detect if a file is text or binary? Check out [bevry/istextorbinary](https://github.com/bevry/istextorbinary)

Install

npm
  • Install: npm install --save textextensions
  • Import: import pkg from ('textextensions')
  • Require: const pkg = require('textextensions').default

pika

 ``` html ```

unpkg

 ``` html ```

jspm

 ``` html ```

Editions

This package is published with the following editions:

  • textextensions/source/index.ts is TypeScript source code with Import for modules
  • textextensions/edition-browsers/index.js is TypeScript compiled against ES2019 for web browsers with Import for modules
  • textextensions aliases textextensions/edition-es5/index.js
  • textextensions/edition-es5/index.js is TypeScript compiled against ES5 for Node.js with Require for modules

  • textextensions/source/index.ts is TypeScript source code with Import for modules
  • textextensions/edition-browsers/index.js is TypeScript compiled against ES2019 for web browsers with Import for modules
  • textextensions aliases textextensions/edition-es5/index.js
  • textextensions/edition-es5/index.js is TypeScript compiled against ES5 for Node.js with Require for modules
  • textextensions/edition-deno/index.ts is TypeScript source code made to be compatible with Deno

Discover the release history by heading on over to the HISTORY.md file.

5.7.0.name: textextensions

editions.description: TypeScript source code with Import for modules
TypeScript compiled against ES2019 for web browsers with Import for modules
TypeScript compiled against ES5 for Node.js with Require for modules
TypeScript source code made to be compatible with Deno

scripts.our:compile: yarn run our:compile:deno && yarn run our:compile:edition-browsers && yarn run our:compile:edition-es5 && yarn run our:compile:types
scripts.our:compile:edition-browsers: tsc --module ESNext --target ES2019 --outDir ./edition-browsers --project tsconfig.json && ( test ! -d edition-browsers/source || ( mv edition-browsers/source edition-temp && rm -Rf edition-browsers && mv edition-temp edition-browsers ) )
scripts.our:compile:edition-es5: tsc --module commonjs --target ES5 --outDir ./edition-es5 --project tsconfig.json && ( test ! -d edition-es5/source || ( mv edition-es5/source edition-temp && rm -Rf edition-es5 && mv edition-temp edition-es5 ) )
scripts.our:compile:types: tsc --project tsconfig.json --emitDeclarationOnly --declaration --declarationMap --declarationDir ./compiled-types && ( test ! -d compiled-types/source || ( mv compiled-types/source edition-temp && rm -Rf compiled-types && mv edition-temp compiled-types ) )
scripts.our:deploy: echo no need for this project
scripts.our:meta: yarn run our:meta:contributors && yarn run our:meta:docs && yarn run our:meta:projectz
scripts.our:release: yarn run our:release:prepare && yarn run our:release:check-changelog && yarn run our:release:check-dirty && yarn run our:release:tag && yarn run our:release:push
scripts.our:release:check-changelog: cat ./HISTORY.md | grep v$npm_package_version || (echo add a changelog entry for v$npm_package_version && exit -1)
scripts.our:release:prepare: yarn run our:clean && yarn run our:compile && yarn run our:test && yarn run our:meta
scripts.our:release:push: git push origin master && git push origin --tags
scripts.our:release:tag: export MESSAGE=$(cat ./HISTORY.md | sed -n "/## v$npm_package_version/,/##/p" | sed 's/## //' | awk 'NR>1{print buf}{buf = $0}') && test "$MESSAGE" || (echo 'proper changelog entry not found' && exit -1) && git tag v$npm_package_version -am "$MESSAGE"
scripts.our:verify: yarn run our:verify:directory && yarn run our:verify:eslint && yarn run our:verify:module && yarn run our:verify:prettier

5.8.0-next.1595452080.4c8c5e6352165d0f0a.readme:
The Definitive List of Text Extensions


A package that contains an array of every single file extension there is for text files ## Usage [Complete API Documentation.](http://master.textextensions.bevry.surge.sh/docs/globals.html) ```typescript import list from 'textextensions' console.log(list) ``` ```javascript const list = require('textextensions').default console.log(list) ``` JSON also available via `textextensions/list.json` CDN access available via https://unpkg.com/textextensions/list.json Missing an extension? [Send a pull request!](https://github.com/bevry/textextensions/edit/master/source/index.ts) Want a definitive list of binary extensions? Check out [bevry/binaryextensions](https://github.com/bevry/binaryextensions) Want to detect if a file is text or binary? Check out [bevry/istextorbinary](https://github.com/bevry/istextorbinary)

Install

npm
  • Install: npm install --save textextensions
  • Import: import pkg from ('textextensions')
  • Require: const pkg = require('textextensions').default

Deno

 ``` typescript import pkg from 'https://unpkg.com/textextensions@^5.8.0/edition-deno/index.ts' ```

pika

 ``` html ```

unpkg

 ``` html ```

jspm

 ``` html ```

Editions

This package is published with the following editions:

  • textextensions/source/index.ts is TypeScript source code with Import for modules
  • textextensions/edition-browsers/index.js is TypeScript compiled against ES2019 for web browsers with Import for modules
  • textextensions aliases textextensions/edition-es5/index.js
  • textextensions/edition-es5/index.js is TypeScript compiled against ES5 for Node.js with Require for modules
  • textextensions/edition-node-esm/index.js is TypeScript compiled against ES5 for Node.js with Import for modules
  • textextensions/edition-deno/index.ts is TypeScript source code made to be compatible with Deno

scripts.our:compile: npm run our:compile:deno && npm run our:compile:edition-browsers && npm run our:compile:edition-es5 && npm run our:compile:edition-node-esm && npm run our:compile:types
scripts.our:compile:edition-browsers: tsc --module ESNext --target ES2019 --outDir ./edition-browsers --project tsconfig.json && ( test ! -d edition-browsers/source || ( mv edition-browsers/source edition-temp && rm -Rf edition-browsers && mv edition-temp edition-browsers ) )
scripts.our:compile:edition-es5: tsc --module commonjs --target ES5 --outDir ./edition-es5 --project tsconfig.json && ( test ! -d edition-es5/source || ( mv edition-es5/source edition-temp && rm -Rf edition-es5 && mv edition-temp edition-es5 ) ) && echo '{"type": "commonjs"}' > edition-es5/package.json
scripts.our:compile:edition-node-esm: tsc --module ESNext --target ES5 --outDir ./edition-node-esm --project tsconfig.json && ( test ! -d edition-node-esm/source || ( mv edition-node-esm/source edition-temp && rm -Rf edition-node-esm && mv edition-temp edition-node-esm ) ) && echo '{"type": "module"}' > edition-node-esm/package.json
scripts.our:compile:types: tsc --project tsconfig.json --emitDeclarationOnly --declaration --declarationMap --declarationDir ./compiled-types && ( test ! -d compiled-types/source || ( mv compiled-types/source edition-temp && rm -Rf compiled-types && mv edition-temp compiled-types ) )
scripts.our:deploy: echo no need for this project
scripts.our:meta: npm run our:meta:contributors && npm run our:meta:docs && npm run our:meta:projectz
scripts.our:release: npm run our:release:prepare && npm run our:release:check-changelog && npm run our:release:check-dirty && npm run our:release:tag && npm run our:release:push
scripts.our:release:check-changelog: cat ./HISTORY.md | grep v$npm_package_version || (echo add a changelog entry for v$npm_package_version && exit -1)
scripts.our:release:prepare: npm run our:clean && npm run our:compile && npm run our:test && npm run our:meta
scripts.our:release:push: git push origin master && git push origin --tags
scripts.our:release:tag: export MESSAGE=$(cat ./HISTORY.md | sed -n "/## v$npm_package_version/,/##/p" | sed 's/## //' | awk 'NR>1{print buf}{buf = $0}') && test "$MESSAGE" || (echo 'proper changelog entry not found' && exit -1) && git tag v$npm_package_version -am "$MESSAGE"
scripts.our:verify: npm run our:verify:directory && npm run our:verify:eslint && npm run our:verify:module && npm run our:verify:prettier

5.10.0-next.1597702585.5148e26f736e3421a.readme:
The Definitive List of Text Extensions


A package that contains an array of every single file extension there is for text files ## Usage [Complete API Documentation.](http://master.textextensions.bevry.surge.sh/docs/globals.html) ```typescript import list from 'textextensions' console.log(list) ``` ```javascript const list = require('textextensions').default console.log(list) ``` JSON also available via `textextensions/list.json` CDN access available via https://unpkg.com/textextensions/list.json Missing an extension? [Send a pull request!](https://github.com/bevry/textextensions/edit/master/source/index.ts) Want a definitive list of binary extensions? Check out [bevry/binaryextensions](https://github.com/bevry/binaryextensions) Want to detect if a file is text or binary? Check out [bevry/istextorbinary](https://github.com/bevry/istextorbinary)

Install

npm
  • Install: npm install --save textextensions
  • Import: import pkg from ('textextensions')
  • Require: const pkg = require('textextensions').default

Deno

 ``` typescript import pkg from 'https://unpkg.com/textextensions@^5.10.0/edition-deno/index.ts' ```

Skypack

 ``` html ```

unpkg

 ``` html ```

jspm

 ``` html ```

Editions

This package is published with the following editions:

  • textextensions/source/index.ts is TypeScript source code with Import for modules
  • textextensions/edition-browsers/index.js is TypeScript compiled against ES2019 for web browsers with Import for modules
  • textextensions aliases textextensions/edition-es5/index.js
  • textextensions/edition-es5/index.js is TypeScript compiled against ES5 for Node.js with Require for modules
  • textextensions/edition-node-esm/index.js is TypeScript compiled against ES5 for Node.js with Import for modules
  • textextensions/edition-deno/index.ts is TypeScript source code made to be compatible with Deno

History

scripts.our:compile: npm run our:compile:deno && npm run our:compile:edition-browsers && npm run our:compile:edition-es5 && npm run our:compile:edition-node-esm && npm run our:compile:types
scripts.our:compile:edition-browsers: tsc --module ESNext --target ES2019 --outDir ./edition-browsers --project tsconfig.json && ( test ! -d edition-browsers/source || ( mv edition-browsers/source edition-temp && rm -Rf edition-browsers && mv edition-temp edition-browsers ) )
scripts.our:compile:edition-es5: tsc --module commonjs --target ES5 --outDir ./edition-es5 --project tsconfig.json && ( test ! -d edition-es5/source || ( mv edition-es5/source edition-temp && rm -Rf edition-es5 && mv edition-temp edition-es5 ) ) && echo '{"type": "commonjs"}' > edition-es5/package.json
scripts.our:compile:edition-node-esm: tsc --module ESNext --target ES5 --outDir ./edition-node-esm --project tsconfig.json && ( test ! -d edition-node-esm/source || ( mv edition-node-esm/source edition-temp && rm -Rf edition-node-esm && mv edition-temp edition-node-esm ) ) && echo '{"type": "module"}' > edition-node-esm/package.json
scripts.our:compile:types: tsc --project tsconfig.json --emitDeclarationOnly --declaration --declarationMap --declarationDir ./compiled-types && ( test ! -d compiled-types/source || ( mv compiled-types/source edition-temp && rm -Rf compiled-types && mv edition-temp compiled-types ) )
scripts.our:deploy: echo no need for this project
scripts.our:meta: npm run our:meta:contributors && npm run our:meta:docs && npm run our:meta:projectz
scripts.our:release: npm run our:release:prepare && npm run our:release:check-changelog && npm run our:release:check-dirty && npm run our:release:tag && npm run our:release:push
scripts.our:release:check-changelog: cat ./HISTORY.md | grep v$npm_package_version || (echo add a changelog entry for v$npm_package_version && exit -1)
scripts.our:release:prepare: npm run our:clean && npm run our:compile && npm run our:test && npm run our:meta
scripts.our:release:push: git push origin master && git push origin --tags
scripts.our:release:tag: export MESSAGE=$(cat ./HISTORY.md | sed -n "/## v$npm_package_version/,/##/p" | sed 's/## //' | awk 'NR>1{print buf}{buf = $0}') && test "$MESSAGE" || (echo 'proper changelog entry not found' && exit -1) && git tag v$npm_package_version -am "$MESSAGE"
scripts.our:verify: npm run our:verify:directory && npm run our:verify:eslint && npm run our:verify:module && npm run our:verify:prettier

5.10.0-next.1598779955.0e159c6754eba71a5.readme:
The Definitive List of Text Extensions


A package that contains an array of every single file extension there is for text files ## Usage [Complete API Documentation.](http://master.textextensions.bevry.surge.sh/docs/globals.html) ```typescript import list from 'textextensions' console.log(list) ``` ```javascript const list = require('textextensions').default console.log(list) ``` JSON also available via `textextensions/list.json` CDN access available via https://unpkg.com/textextensions/list.json Missing an extension? [Send a pull request!](https://github.com/bevry/textextensions/edit/master/source/index.ts) Want a definitive list of binary extensions? Check out [bevry/binaryextensions](https://github.com/bevry/binaryextensions) Want to detect if a file is text or binary? Check out [bevry/istextorbinary](https://github.com/bevry/istextorbinary)

Install

npm
  • Install: npm install --save textextensions
  • Import: import pkg from ('textextensions')
  • Require: const pkg = require('textextensions').default

Deno

 ``` typescript import pkg from 'https://unpkg.com/textextensions@^5.10.0/edition-deno/index.ts' ```

Skypack

 ``` html ```

unpkg

 ``` html ```

jspm

 ``` html ```

Editions

This package is published with the following editions:

  • textextensions/source/index.ts is TypeScript source code with Import for modules
  • textextensions/edition-browsers/index.js is TypeScript compiled against ES2019 for web browsers with Import for modules
  • textextensions aliases textextensions/edition-es5/index.js
  • textextensions/edition-es5/index.js is TypeScript compiled against ES5 for Node.js with Require for modules
  • textextensions/edition-node-esm/index.js is TypeScript compiled against ES5 for Node.js with Import for modules
  • textextensions/edition-deno/index.ts is TypeScript source code made to be compatible with Deno

History

5.10.0-next.1599205965.fa88676de071b33d4.readme:
The Definitive List of Text Extensions


A package that contains an array of every single file extension there is for text files ## Usage [Complete API Documentation.](http://master.textextensions.bevry.surge.sh/docs/globals.html) ```typescript import list from 'textextensions' console.log(list) ``` ```javascript const list = require('textextensions').default console.log(list) ``` JSON also available via `textextensions/list.json` CDN access available via https://unpkg.com/textextensions/list.json Missing an extension? [Send a pull request!](https://github.com/bevry/textextensions/edit/master/source/index.ts) Want a definitive list of binary extensions? Check out [bevry/binaryextensions](https://github.com/bevry/binaryextensions) Want to detect if a file is text or binary? Check out [bevry/istextorbinary](https://github.com/bevry/istextorbinary)

Install

npm
  • Install: npm install --save textextensions
  • Import: import pkg from ('textextensions')
  • Require: const pkg = require('textextensions').default

Deno

 ``` typescript import pkg from 'https://unpkg.com/textextensions@^5.10.0/edition-deno/index.ts' ```

Skypack

 ``` html ```

unpkg

 ``` html ```

jspm

 ``` html ```

Editions

This package is published with the following editions:

  • textextensions/source/index.ts is TypeScript source code with Import for modules
  • textextensions/edition-browsers/index.js is TypeScript compiled against ES2019 for web browsers with Import for modules
  • textextensions aliases textextensions/edition-es5/index.js
  • textextensions/edition-es5/index.js is TypeScript compiled against ES5 for Node.js with Require for modules
  • textextensions/edition-node-esm/index.js is TypeScript compiled against ES5 for Node.js with Import for modules
  • textextensions/edition-deno/index.ts is TypeScript source code made to be compatible with Deno

scripts.our:compile:edition-browsers: tsc --module ESNext --target ES2019 --outDir ./edition-browsers --project tsconfig.json && ( test ! -d edition-browsers/source || ( mv edition-browsers/source edition-temp && rm -Rf edition-browsers && mv edition-temp edition-browsers ) )
scripts.our:compile:edition-es5: tsc --module commonjs --target ES5 --outDir ./edition-es5 --project tsconfig.json && ( test ! -d edition-es5/source || ( mv edition-es5/source edition-temp && rm -Rf edition-es5 && mv edition-temp edition-es5 ) ) && echo '{"type": "commonjs"}' > edition-es5/package.json
scripts.our:compile:edition-es5-esm: tsc --module ESNext --target ES5 --outDir ./edition-es5-esm --project tsconfig.json && ( test ! -d edition-es5-esm/source || ( mv edition-es5-esm/source edition-temp && rm -Rf edition-es5-esm && mv edition-temp edition-es5-esm ) ) && echo '{"type": "module"}' > edition-es5-esm/package.json
scripts.our:compile:types: tsc --project tsconfig.json --emitDeclarationOnly --declaration --declarationMap --declarationDir ./compiled-types && ( test ! -d compiled-types/source || ( mv compiled-types/source edition-temp && rm -Rf compiled-types && mv edition-temp compiled-types ) )
scripts.our:deploy: echo no need for this project
scripts.our:meta: npm run our:meta:contributors && npm run our:meta:docs && npm run our:meta:projectz
scripts.our:release: npm run our:release:prepare && npm run our:release:check-changelog && npm run our:release:check-dirty && npm run our:release:tag && npm run our:release:push
scripts.our:release:check-changelog: cat ./HISTORY.md | grep v$npm_package_version || (echo add a changelog entry for v$npm_package_version && exit -1)
scripts.our:release:prepare: npm run our:clean && npm run our:compile && npm run our:test && npm run our:meta
scripts.our:release:push: git push origin master && git push origin --tags
scripts.our:release:tag: export MESSAGE=$(cat ./HISTORY.md | sed -n "/## v$npm_package_version/,/##/p" | sed 's/## //' | awk 'NR>1{print buf}{buf = $0}') && test "$MESSAGE" || (echo 'proper changelog entry not found' && exit -1) && git tag v$npm_package_version -am "$MESSAGE"
scripts.our:verify: npm run our:verify:directory && npm run our:verify:eslint && npm run our:verify:module && npm run our:verify:prettier

5.11.0-next.1599395307.5ed63643f93198c69.readme:
The Definitive List of Text Extensions


A package that contains an array of every single file extension there is for text files ## Usage [Complete API Documentation.](http://master.textextensions.bevry.surge.sh/docs/globals.html) ```typescript import list from 'textextensions' console.log(list) ``` ```javascript const list = require('textextensions').default console.log(list) ``` JSON also available via `textextensions/list.json` CDN access available via https://unpkg.com/textextensions/list.json Missing an extension? [Send a pull request!](https://github.com/bevry/textextensions/edit/master/source/index.ts) Want a definitive list of binary extensions? Check out [bevry/binaryextensions](https://github.com/bevry/binaryextensions) Want to detect if a file is text or binary? Check out [bevry/istextorbinary](https://github.com/bevry/istextorbinary)

Install

npm
  • Install: npm install --save textextensions
  • Import: import pkg from ('textextensions')
  • Require: const pkg = require('textextensions').default

Deno

 ``` typescript import pkg from 'https://unpkg.com/textextensions@^5.11.0/edition-deno/index.ts' ```

Skypack

 ``` html ```

unpkg

 ``` html ```

jspm

 ``` html ```

Editions

This package is published with the following editions:

  • textextensions/source/index.ts is TypeScript source code with Import for modules
  • textextensions/edition-browsers/index.js is TypeScript compiled against ES2019 for web browsers with Import for modules
  • textextensions aliases textextensions/edition-es5/index.js
  • textextensions/edition-es5/index.js is TypeScript compiled against ES5 for Node.js with Require for modules
  • textextensions/edition-es5-esm/index.js is TypeScript compiled against ES5 for Node.js with Import for modules
  • textextensions/edition-deno/index.ts is TypeScript source code made to be compatible with Deno

History

5.11.0-next.1600599083.0e95b74ebd28efbe3.readme:
The Definitive List of Text Extensions


A package that contains an array of every single file extension there is for text files ## Usage [Complete API Documentation.](http://master.textextensions.bevry.surge.sh/docs/globals.html) ```typescript import list from 'textextensions' console.log(list) ``` ```javascript const list = require('textextensions').default console.log(list) ``` JSON also available via `textextensions/list.json` CDN access available via https://unpkg.com/textextensions/list.json Missing an extension? [Send a pull request!](https://github.com/bevry/textextensions/edit/master/source/index.ts) Want a definitive list of binary extensions? Check out [bevry/binaryextensions](https://github.com/bevry/binaryextensions) Want to detect if a file is text or binary? Check out [bevry/istextorbinary](https://github.com/bevry/istextorbinary)

Install

npm
  • Install: npm install --save textextensions
  • Import: import pkg from ('textextensions')
  • Require: const pkg = require('textextensions').default

Deno

 ``` typescript import pkg from 'https://unpkg.com/textextensions@^5.11.0/edition-deno/index.ts' ```

Skypack

 ``` html ```

unpkg

 ``` html ```

jspm

 ``` html ```

Editions

This package is published with the following editions:

  • textextensions/source/index.ts is TypeScript source code with Import for modules
  • textextensions/edition-browsers/index.js is TypeScript compiled against ES2019 for web browsers with Import for modules
  • textextensions aliases textextensions/edition-es5/index.js
  • textextensions/edition-es5/index.js is TypeScript compiled against ES5 for Node.js with Require for modules
  • textextensions/edition-es5-esm/index.js is TypeScript compiled against ES5 for Node.js with Import for modules
  • textextensions/edition-deno/index.ts is TypeScript source code made to be compatible with Deno

The Definitive List of Text Extensions


A package that contains an array of every single file extension there is for text files ## Usage [Complete API Documentation.](http://master.textextensions.bevry.surge.sh/docs/globals.html) ```typescript import list from 'textextensions' console.log(list) ``` ```javascript const list = require('textextensions').default console.log(list) ``` JSON also available via `textextensions/list.json` CDN access available via https://unpkg.com/textextensions/list.json Missing an extension? [Send a pull request!](https://github.com/bevry/textextensions/edit/master/source/index.ts) Want a definitive list of binary extensions? Check out [bevry/binaryextensions](https://github.com/bevry/binaryextensions) Want to detect if a file is text or binary? Check out [bevry/istextorbinary](https://github.com/bevry/istextorbinary)

Install

npm
  • Install: npm install --save textextensions
  • Import: import pkg from ('textextensions')
  • Require: const pkg = require('textextensions').default

Deno

 ``` typescript import pkg from 'https://unpkg.com/textextensions@^5.11.0/edition-deno/index.ts' ```

Skypack

 ``` html ```

unpkg

 ``` html ```

jspm

 ``` html ```

Editions

This package is published with the following editions:

  • textextensions/source/index.ts is TypeScript source code with Import for modules
  • textextensions/edition-browsers/index.js is TypeScript compiled against ES2019 for web browsers with Import for modules
  • textextensions aliases textextensions/edition-es5/index.js
  • textextensions/edition-es5/index.js is TypeScript compiled against ES5 for Node.js with Require for modules
  • textextensions/edition-es5-esm/index.js is TypeScript compiled against ES5 for Node.js with Import for modules
  • textextensions/edition-deno/index.ts is TypeScript source code made to be compatible with Deno

History

5.11.0-next.1602408191.4767fd0d15bcf37b2.title: The Definitive List of Text Extensions
5.11.0-next.1602408191.4767fd0d15bcf37b2.name: textextensions
5.11.0-next.1602408191.4767fd0d15bcf37b2.description: A package that contains an array of every single file extension there is for text files

editions.description: TypeScript source code with Import for modules
TypeScript compiled against ES2019 for web browsers with Import for modules
TypeScript compiled against ES5 for Node.js with Require for modules
TypeScript compiled against ES5 for Node.js with Import for modules
TypeScript source code made to be compatible with Deno

scripts.our:compile: npm run our:compile:deno && npm run our:compile:edition-browsers && npm run our:compile:edition-es5 && npm run our:compile:edition-es5-esm && npm run our:compile:types
scripts.our:compile:edition-browsers: tsc --module ESNext --target ES2019 --outDir ./edition-browsers --project tsconfig.json && ( test ! -d edition-browsers/source || ( mv edition-browsers/source edition-temp && rm -Rf edition-browsers && mv edition-temp edition-browsers ) )
scripts.our:compile:edition-es5: tsc --module commonjs --target ES5 --outDir ./edition-es5 --project tsconfig.json && ( test ! -d edition-es5/source || ( mv edition-es5/source edition-temp && rm -Rf edition-es5 && mv edition-temp edition-es5 ) ) && echo '{"type": "commonjs"}' > edition-es5/package.json
scripts.our:compile:edition-es5-esm: tsc --module ESNext --target ES5 --outDir ./edition-es5-esm --project tsconfig.json && ( test ! -d edition-es5-esm/source || ( mv edition-es5-esm/source edition-temp && rm -Rf edition-es5-esm && mv edition-temp edition-es5-esm ) ) && echo '{"type": "module"}' > edition-es5-esm/package.json
scripts.our:compile:types: tsc --project tsconfig.json --emitDeclarationOnly --declaration --declarationMap --declarationDir ./compiled-types && ( test ! -d compiled-types/source || ( mv compiled-types/source edition-temp && rm -Rf compiled-types && mv edition-temp compiled-types ) )
scripts.our:deploy: echo no need for this project
scripts.our:meta: npm run our:meta:contributors && npm run our:meta:docs && npm run our:meta:projectz
scripts.our:release: npm run our:release:prepare && npm run our:release:check-changelog && npm run our:release:check-dirty && npm run our:release:tag && npm run our:release:push
scripts.our:release:check-changelog: cat ./HISTORY.md | grep v$npm_package_version || (echo add a changelog entry for v$npm_package_version && exit -1)
scripts.our:release:prepare: npm run our:clean && npm run our:compile && npm run our:test && npm run our:meta
scripts.our:release:push: git push origin master && git push origin --tags
scripts.our:release:tag: export MESSAGE=$(cat ./HISTORY.md | sed -n "/## v$npm_package_version/,/##/p" | sed 's/## //' | awk 'NR>1{print buf}{buf = $0}') && test "$MESSAGE" || (echo 'proper changelog entry not found' && exit -1) && git tag v$npm_package_version -am "$MESSAGE"
scripts.our:verify: npm run our:verify:directory && npm run our:verify:eslint && npm run our:verify:module && npm run our:verify:prettier

5.11.0-next.1603623670.18aa03c80de28f1db.title: The Definitive List of Text Extensions
5.11.0-next.1603623670.18aa03c80de28f1db.name: textextensions
5.11.0-next.1603623670.18aa03c80de28f1db.description: A package that contains an array of every single file extension there is for text files

editions.description: TypeScript source code with Import for modules
TypeScript compiled against ES2019 for web browsers with Import for modules
TypeScript compiled against ES5 for Node.js with Require for modules
TypeScript compiled against ES5 for Node.js with Import for modules
TypeScript source code made to be compatible with Deno

scripts.our:compile: npm run our:compile:deno && npm run our:compile:edition-browsers && npm run our:compile:edition-es5 && npm run our:compile:edition-es5-esm && npm run our:compile:types
scripts.our:compile:edition-browsers: tsc --module ESNext --target ES2019 --outDir ./edition-browsers --project tsconfig.json && ( test ! -d edition-browsers/source || ( mv edition-browsers/source edition-temp && rm -Rf edition-browsers && mv edition-temp edition-browsers ) )
scripts.our:compile:edition-es5: tsc --module commonjs --target ES5 --outDir ./edition-es5 --project tsconfig.json && ( test ! -d edition-es5/source || ( mv edition-es5/source edition-temp && rm -Rf edition-es5 && mv edition-temp edition-es5 ) ) && echo '{"type": "commonjs"}' > edition-es5/package.json
scripts.our:compile:edition-es5-esm: tsc --module ESNext --target ES5 --outDir ./edition-es5-esm --project tsconfig.json && ( test ! -d edition-es5-esm/source || ( mv edition-es5-esm/source edition-temp && rm -Rf edition-es5-esm && mv edition-temp edition-es5-esm ) ) && echo '{"type": "module"}' > edition-es5-esm/package.json
scripts.our:compile:types: tsc --project tsconfig.json --emitDeclarationOnly --declaration --declarationMap --declarationDir ./compiled-types && ( test ! -d compiled-types/source || ( mv compiled-types/source edition-temp && rm -Rf compiled-types && mv edition-temp compiled-types ) )
scripts.our:deploy: echo no need for this project
scripts.our:meta: npm run our:meta:contributors && npm run our:meta:docs && npm run our:meta:projectz
scripts.our:release: npm run our:release:prepare && npm run our:release:check-changelog && npm run our:release:check-dirty && npm run our:release:tag && npm run our:release:push
scripts.our:release:check-changelog: cat ./HISTORY.md | grep v$npm_package_version || (echo add a changelog entry for v$npm_package_version && exit -1)
scripts.our:release:prepare: npm run our:clean && npm run our:compile && npm run our:test && npm run our:meta
scripts.our:release:push: git push origin master && git push origin --tags
scripts.our:release:tag: export MESSAGE=$(cat ./HISTORY.md | sed -n "/## v$npm_package_version/,/##/p" | sed 's/## //' | awk 'NR>1{print buf}{buf = $0}') && test "$MESSAGE" || (echo 'proper changelog entry not found' && exit -1) && git tag v$npm_package_version -am "$MESSAGE"
scripts.our:verify: npm run our:verify:directory && npm run our:verify:eslint && npm run our:verify:module && npm run our:verify:prettier

5.11.0-next.1603623670.18aa03c80de28f1db.readme:
The Definitive List of Text Extensions


A package that contains an array of every single file extension there is for text files ## Usage [Complete API Documentation.](http://master.textextensions.bevry.surge.sh/docs/globals.html) ```typescript import list from 'textextensions' console.log(list) ``` ```javascript const list = require('textextensions').default console.log(list) ``` JSON also available via `textextensions/list.json` CDN access available via https://unpkg.com/textextensions/list.json Missing an extension? [Send a pull request!](https://github.com/bevry/textextensions/edit/master/source/index.ts) Want a definitive list of binary extensions? Check out [bevry/binaryextensions](https://github.com/bevry/binaryextensions) Want to detect if a file is text or binary? Check out [bevry/istextorbinary](https://github.com/bevry/istextorbinary)

Install

npm
  • Install: npm install --save textextensions
  • Import: import pkg from ('textextensions')
  • Require: const pkg = require('textextensions').default

Deno

 ``` typescript import pkg from 'https://unpkg.com/textextensions@^5.11.0/edition-deno/index.ts' ```

Skypack

 ``` html ```

unpkg

 ``` html ```

jspm

 ``` html ```

Editions

This package is published with the following editions:

  • textextensions/source/index.ts is TypeScript source code with Import for modules
  • textextensions/edition-browsers/index.js is TypeScript compiled against ES2019 for web browsers with Import for modules
  • textextensions aliases textextensions/edition-es5/index.js
  • textextensions/edition-es5/index.js is TypeScript compiled against ES5 for Node.js with Require for modules
  • textextensions/edition-es5-esm/index.js is TypeScript compiled against ES5 for Node.js with Import for modules
  • textextensions/edition-deno/index.ts is TypeScript source code made to be compatible with Deno

5.12.0-next.1603943287.e1a53e85368910709.readme:
The Definitive List of Text Extensions


A package that contains an array of every single file extension there is for text files ## Usage [Complete API Documentation.](http://master.textextensions.bevry.surge.sh/docs/globals.html) ```typescript import list from 'textextensions' console.log(list) ``` ```javascript const list = require('textextensions').default console.log(list) ``` JSON also available via `textextensions/list.json` CDN access available via https://unpkg.com/textextensions/list.json Missing an extension? [Send a pull request!](https://github.com/bevry/textextensions/edit/master/source/index.ts) Want a definitive list of binary extensions? Check out [bevry/binaryextensions](https://github.com/bevry/binaryextensions) Want to detect if a file is text or binary? Check out [bevry/istextorbinary](https://github.com/bevry/istextorbinary)

Install

npm
  • Install: npm install --save textextensions
  • Import: import pkg from ('textextensions')
  • Require: const pkg = require('textextensions').default

Deno

 ``` typescript import pkg from 'https://unpkg.com/textextensions@^5.12.0/edition-deno/index.ts' ```

Skypack

 ``` html ```

unpkg

 ``` html ```

jspm

 ``` html ```

Editions

This package is published with the following editions:

  • textextensions/source/index.ts is TypeScript source code with Import for modules
  • textextensions/edition-browsers/index.js is TypeScript compiled against ES2019 for web browsers with Import for modules
  • textextensions aliases textextensions/edition-es5/index.js
  • textextensions/edition-es5/index.js is TypeScript compiled against ES5 for Node.js with Require for modules
  • textextensions/edition-es5-esm/index.js is TypeScript compiled against ES5 for Node.js with Import for modules
  • textextensions/edition-deno/index.ts is TypeScript source code made to be compatible with Deno

5.13.0-next.1627432619.fea21de250118c167.readme:
The Definitive List of Text Extensions


A package that contains an array of every single file extension there is for text files ## Usage [Complete API Documentation.](http://master.textextensions.bevry.surge.sh/docs/globals.html) ```typescript import list from 'textextensions' console.log(list) ``` ```javascript const list = require('textextensions').default console.log(list) ``` JSON also available via `textextensions/list.json` CDN access available via https://unpkg.com/textextensions/list.json Missing an extension? [Send a pull request!](https://github.com/bevry/textextensions/edit/master/source/index.ts) Want a definitive list of binary extensions? Check out [bevry/binaryextensions](https://github.com/bevry/binaryextensions) Want to detect if a file is text or binary? Check out [bevry/istextorbinary](https://github.com/bevry/istextorbinary)

Install

npm
  • Install: npm install --save textextensions
  • Import: import pkg from ('textextensions')
  • Require: const pkg = require('textextensions').default

Skypack

 ``` html ```

unpkg

 ``` html ```

jspm

 ``` html ```

Editions

This package is published with the following editions:

  • textextensions/source/index.ts is TypeScript source code with Import for modules
  • textextensions/edition-browsers/index.js is TypeScript compiled against ES2020 for web browsers with Import for modules
  • textextensions aliases textextensions/edition-es5/index.js
  • textextensions/edition-es5/index.js is TypeScript compiled against ES5 for Node.js with Require for modules
  • textextensions/edition-es5-esm/index.js is TypeScript compiled against ES5 for Node.js with Import for modules

History

Discover the release history by heading on over to the HISTORY.md file.

scripts.our:compile:edition-es5-esm: tsc --module ESNext --target ES5 --outDir ./edition-es5-esm --project tsconfig.json && ( test ! -d edition-es5-esm/source || ( mv edition-es5-esm/source edition-temp && rm -Rf edition-es5-esm && mv edition-temp edition-es5-esm ) ) && echo '{"type": "module"}' > edition-es5-esm/package.json
scripts.our:compile:types: tsc --project tsconfig.json --emitDeclarationOnly --declaration --declarationMap --declarationDir ./compiled-types && ( test ! -d compiled-types/source || ( mv compiled-types/source edition-temp && rm -Rf compiled-types && mv edition-temp compiled-types ) )
scripts.our:deploy: echo no need for this project
scripts.our:meta: npm run our:meta:contributors && npm run our:meta:docs && npm run our:meta:projectz
scripts.our:release: npm run our:release:prepare && npm run our:release:check-changelog && npm run our:release:check-dirty && npm run our:release:tag && npm run our:release:push
scripts.our:release:check-changelog: cat ./HISTORY.md | grep v$npm_package_version || (echo add a changelog entry for v$npm_package_version && exit -1)
scripts.our:release:prepare: npm run our:clean && npm run our:compile && npm run our:test && npm run our:meta
scripts.our:release:push: git push origin && git push origin --tags
scripts.our:release:tag: export MESSAGE=$(cat ./HISTORY.md | sed -n "/## v$npm_package_version/,/##/p" | sed 's/## //' | awk 'NR>1{print buf}{buf = $0}') && test "$MESSAGE" || (echo 'proper changelog entry not found' && exit -1) && git tag v$npm_package_version -am "$MESSAGE"
scripts.our:verify: npm run our:verify:directory && npm run our:verify:eslint && npm run our:verify:module && npm run our:verify:prettier

5.15.0-next.1649156240.b1a7d5ed11e71fa4a.readme:
The Definitive List of Text Extensions


A package that contains an array of every single file extension there is for text files ## Usage [Complete API Documentation.](http://master.textextensions.bevry.surge.sh/docs/) ```typescript import list from 'textextensions' console.log(list) ``` ```javascript const list = require('textextensions').default console.log(list) ``` JSON also available via `textextensions/list.json` CDN access available via https://unpkg.com/textextensions/list.json Missing an extension? [Send a pull request!](https://github.com/bevry/textextensions/edit/master/source/index.ts) Want a definitive list of binary extensions? Check out [bevry/binaryextensions](https://github.com/bevry/binaryextensions) Want to detect if a file is text or binary? Check out [bevry/istextorbinary](https://github.com/bevry/istextorbinary)

Install

npm
  • Install: npm install --save textextensions
  • Import: import pkg from ('textextensions')
  • Require: const pkg = require('textextensions').default

Skypack

 ``` html ```

unpkg

 ``` html ```

jspm

 ``` html ```

Editions

This package is published with the following editions:

  • textextensions/source/index.ts is TypeScript source code with Import for modules
  • textextensions/edition-browsers/index.js is TypeScript compiled against ES2020 for web browsers with Import for modules
  • textextensions aliases textextensions/edition-es5/index.js
  • textextensions/edition-es5/index.js is TypeScript compiled against ES5 for Node.js with Require for modules
  • textextensions/edition-es5-esm/index.js is TypeScript compiled against ES5 for Node.js with Import for modules
